newsitem.title: TAIWAN: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - September 3.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - September 3.

text.p: CHINA TIMES - Eleven-year-old boy escapes by himself after being kidnapped for a day.
Lin Hsing-shan, head of a private Taiwan group promoting direct shipping links with China, says he is confident that direct links will start by the end of 1996.
UNITED DAILY NEWS - High court judge Tsai Hsin-nan is suspected of taking bribes.
Lin Hsing-shan says direct shipping links with China are likely to start by the end of 1996.
COMMERCIAL TIMES - The finance ministry and the central bank differ in what fields new commercial bank can operate.
The Council for Economic Planning and Development revises per capita income forecast for the year 2000 to less than US$20,000 from previous US$20,000.
ECONOMIC DAILY NEWS - International oil prices soar over Iraq oil sales delay.
Shipping executives from Taiwan and China will hold talks on direct shipping links in Hong Kong in October.
